main event: On May 22, 1957, in New York, NY, a bright flashing white light was observed moving east and then straight upwards for three minutes.
interesting points: The observation was categorized as a ground-radar and air view sighting.
The duration of the sighting was 5-10 minutes, allowing for an extended period of observation.
The report concluded that the sighting was likely caused by an aircraft based on the duration and flight path.
No sound was reported despite the bright flashing white light.
The object was observed due north of a post about 5 to 6 miles away, heading east of the post.
